intro: Coriandrum sativum var. vavilovii, commonly known as the Crimean coriander, is a wild variety of the coriander plant native to the Caucasus and Central Asia. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. This variety is often used in traditional medicine for its aromatic properties and potential health benefits. It thrives in temperate climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its seeds, like those of the common coriander, are used in culinary applications and herbal remedies.
